message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with the problem of learning a most biased coin among a set of coins by tossing them adaptively. This problem is closely related to finding the best arm in the multi-armed bandit problem using adaptive strategies, which is a well-studied problem in machine learning and artificial intelligence. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The paper also employs tools from the field of Markov games, which suggests that it may also belong to cs.IT (Information Theory) or cs.GT (Game Theory).
